title.$t: Nationwide Building Society online banking login is broken because onblur is fired before onfocus or onchange

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.212.0 (Ubuntu build 26664) OS + version : Ubuntu 8.0.4 CPU architecture (32-bit / 64-bit): i386 URLs (if applicable) : https://olb2.nationet.com/signon/index2.asp (or goto http://www.nationwide.co.uk/ and click "Sign on") Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): Fine with 3.5.2 (also all earlier ones AFAIK) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Goto https://olb2.nationet.com/signon/index2.asp 2. Attempt to enter passnumber digits What is the expected result? Digits for each box are initially present, but become *'s once entered What happens instead? They're *'s to start with, making entering the pin somewhat difficult!

title.$t: ChromeFrame does not respect IE Privacy features

content.$t: Chrome Version : Google Chrome 4.0.211.7 (Official Build 26751) WebKit 532.0 V8 1.3.11 User Agent Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.2; en-US) AppleWebKit/532.0 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/4.0.211.7 Safari/532.0 URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: n/a Firefox 3.x: n/a IE 7: FAIL IE 8: FAIL What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Visit cf:http://code.google.com/apis/gears/samples/hello_world_database.html 2. Allow access to DB 3. Add entries. 4. Click Tools / Delete Browser History. Delete ALL. 5. Restart IE. 6. Revisit cf:http://code.google.com/apis/gears/samples/hello_world_database.html Expect: History deleted. Actual: History not deleted. 1. Start IE8 in InPrivate mode (use -private command line) 2. Visit cf:http://code.google.com/apis/gears/samples/hello_world_database.html Expect: Database starts empty. Actual: Database entries present. 3. Enter some database changes. 4. Close IE8. 5. Restart IE8 and visit cf:http://code.google.com/apis/gears/samples/hello_world_database.html Expect: Database entries created InPrivate are deleted. Actual: Privacy circumvented. ChromeFrame and/or Gears should respect the user's privacy preferences and actions. See http://blogs.msdn.com/ieinternals/archive/2009/06/30/IE8- Privacy-APIs-for-Addons.aspx for more information.

title.$t: Browser actions: implement setIcon(ImageData)

content.$t:
You should be able to draw the browser action icon dynamically using the 
ImageData object from canvas.

title.$t: [CF Full Mode] Forward and back buttons don't work in Wave.

content.$t:
note: this chrome "x-clock"'s correctly so we do not need a cf: prefix.

1) http://go/wave
2) wave opens after the SS0 dance
3) click a wave
4) click another wave

The browsers fwd/back buttons should now be active.  They are not and 
the back button doesn't work, for example.

From joshia:
Well, I think the real issue is that back forward does not work in case the 
navigation happened using '#' (bookmark) or inside any sub frame in the 
page. These type of navigations originate and are consumed by the active 
document (mshtml or Chrome Frame)  and the active document merely tells 
IE to add the navigation entry to its travel log. When back/forward is 
invoked, IE uses a different path to indicate navigations and we don't 
support it yet.

title.$t: [Install/Uninstall] Notify the user whether uninstall succeeded or failed

content.$t:
Right now we don't have any UI showing the progress of uninstall and a 
success/failure dialog at the end of uninstall. I think we need to let the user 
know what happened.

title.$t: Excessive CPU loading Wave the second time

content.$t:
1) Start IE and Wave in ChromeFrame
 2) Exit IE
 3) Start IE and load Wave again

Wave paints, CPU stays at 50%, Wave remains non-interactive.

Win XP SP3, IE6
noel on September 21 2009 00:03 (Assigned)
Notes
Can't repro on IE8 Vista with latest Google Chrome 4.0.211.1 (Official Build 
26333), so IE6 only.

title.$t: Size browser action bubble dynamically

content.$t:
Right now the browser action bubble has a dynamic width and a fixed height. 
We want to change this so that we are dynamic in both directions. This is 
important so that things like localization work smoothly.

Here is how we envision it working:

a) Bubbles will have a minimum width, maximum width, minimum height, and 
maximum height that are some portion of the browser size.

b) We initially size a bubble to the minimum width and minimum height.

c) When the content finishes loading (onload), we get the intrinsic 
dimensions of the content from webcore (the scroll height and width) and 
send them to the browser, which resizes the bubble, which in turn resizes 
the content area.

d) We default the CSS to set body's overflow to hidden, so there will be no 
scrollbars by default.

The sum total of this is that by default the bubble will be some 
"reasonable" width. If the intrinsic size of the layout is wider or taller, 
the bubble will expand up to some maximum size.

There are multiple ways to affect the intrinsic dimensions (particularly 
width) of an HTML document. You can:

* Have an image that is wide
* Use the "nowrap" CSS style on one or more elements that you don't want to 
wrap
* Use the webkit box model which allows flexible-box style layouts in 
HTML/CSS

title.$t: Browser action rendering glitch on first install

content.$t:
There is sometimes a rendering glitch when the first browser actions is first 
installed. Some of the toolbar is not painted next to the omnibox, resulting 
in a white rectangle directly to the right right of the omnibox.

title.$t: Weird transparency glitch with browser actions + gmail checker

content.$t:
The new gmail checker-as-browser action has a weird transparency glitch. Some 
of the pixels near the top of the gmail icon show up the wrong color after it 
rotates. This is especially obvious on dark grey themes.

title.$t: Ensure crash dumps for vista

content.$t:
Crash dumps are not collected on Vista as Chrome Frame runs in low IL IE and can't connect to the pipe 
created by the crash reporting service.  Omaha has fixed this bug by relaxing the permissions so that 
Chrome Frame can connect.

1. We need to test with this and make sure that it works. 
2. Take necessary steps to enable this new version of Omaha/Breakpad for new Chrome Frame installs.

title.$t: [CF Full Mode] Uploading action causes page frozen in wave application

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Login wave application in IE, wave should be rendered by GCF 2. Create a new wave, add some text and then click on the attach button 3. It should prompt for installing gears, accept to install it 4. Upload file dialog should be shown now, just create a .txt file and pick up it to upload What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The text file should be uploaded successfully, but currently page become frozen, nothing clickable.

title.$t: TableView double-frees imagelist

content.$t:
TableView::OnDestory needlessly, and harmfully, frees the
attached imagelist.
Because LVS_SHAREIMAGELISTS was not used, the ListView
owns the imagelist, and it is an error to free it.

Presumably this would be caught by Application Verifier;
I happened to catch it using Wine and Valgrind.

See
http://blog.m-ri.de/index.php/2007/03/02/der-application-verifier-mein-
neuer-freund
or
http://bugs.winehq.org/show_bug.cgi?id=20553

title.$t: REGRESSION: Forward on the context menu doesn't work

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Navigate to www.youtube.com 2. Click on a video 3. Bring up context menu and select Back 4. Bring up context menu again What is the expected output? Forward should be active What do you see instead? Forward isn't active Happening with CF 4.0.255.0 (Official Build 32762)

title.$t: We need reliability tests for ChromeFrame

content.$t:
Reliability tests for ChromeFrame on similar lines as Chrome would be 
extremely helpful to catch race conditions and other regressions in 
ChromeFrame builds.

title.$t: Multiple Exceptions windows can exist in the Content Settings UI

content.$t: Chrome 4.1.249.1003 (Official Build 38072) Currently, feature exists on Windows only. What steps will reproduce the problem? -------------------------------------- 1. Options > Content Settings. 2. Press "Exceptions..." button multiple times. What is the expected output? ---------------------------- Only one Cookie Exceptions window should exist at any time. What do you see instead? ------------------------ Multiple Cookie Exceptions windows pop up.

title.$t: Pop-up settings changed in bubble appear not to be saved (but really are)

content.$t: Google Chrome 5.0.317.2 (Official Build 38193) Implemented in Windows only at this point. What steps will reproduce the problem? -------------------------------------- Preconditions: -------------- Options > Under the Hood > Content Settings... > Pop-ups: select "Do not allow any site to show pop-ups". Repro: ------ 1. Go to http://www.andrewkantor.com/popupdemo/popuptest.html 2. Click on the popup-blocker icon in the Omnibox. 3. Note that "Continue blocking pop-ups" is selected by default. 3. In the bubble, select "Always allow popups from www.andrewkantor.com". 4. Close, reopen the bubble. What is the expected output? ---------------------------- "Always allow popups from www.andrewkantor.com" should still be selected. What do you see instead? ------------------------ Selection has reverted to "Continue blocking pop-ups". Note: although the new setting does not appear to persist, the Pop-up Exceptions dialog correctly shows an entry allowing popups from www.andrewkantor.com. So it appears to be a problem within the bubble itself.

title.$t: Internal pages maybe shouldn't be affected by Content Settings

content.$t: Chrome 5.0.317.2 (Official Build 38193) Content Settings currently implemented on Windows only. This issue applies to chrome://newtab/, chrome://extensions/, chrome://history/, chrome://downloads/, etc. Also, to about:version, about:plugins, about:memory, etc. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Options > Under the Hood > Content Settings... > Images: Select "Do not allow any site to run JavaScript". 2. Open New Tab page (or other page mentioned above). What is the expected output? New Tab page should look normal. What do you see instead? New Tab page looks weird: * No thumbnails. * No recently closed pages/tabs. see attached picture.

title.$t: Popup blocking mechanism doesn't allow CF to show user initiated popup windows

content.$t: New Chrome Feature doesn't hide popups anymore. They block them completely. In Chrome we get an icon in omnibox when this happens to whitelist the website. In ChromeFrame, icon doesn't come. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to http://www.meebo.com 2. Click on link 'Connect to Facebook' What is the expected output? Window should popup where we can enter login credentials What do you see instead? Nothing happens Same is the case with http://webmessenger.yahoo.com CF 5.0.317.0 (Official Build 38070)

title.$t: Content Settings dialog width should be larger

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. On Windows XP, download http://build.chromium.org/buildbot/snapshots/chromium-rel-xp/38320/chrome- win32.zip, and then run chrome.exe. 2. Open Options -> Under the Hood -> Content settings... 3. The [Adobe Flash Player settings manager...] link does not appear at the bottom of the dialog. I tried this on Windows Vista and I *do* see the link. I've tried on multiple Windows XP laptops and I do *not* see the link. See attached screenshots (one for XP, one for Vista).

title.$t: Chrome will not quit after closing all windows once "Adobe Flash Player storage settings" link is clicked

content.$t: Chrome Version : 5.0.317.2 (Official Build 38193) Other browsers tested: Chromium Build 38327: FAIL What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Open [Options] > [Under the hood] > [Content settings]. 2.Click on "Adobe Flash Player storage settings..." link. A "Website Storage Settings panel" page of www.macromedia.com will be opened in new window. 3.Close all windows of Chrome to quit. 4.Launch Windows task manager and search for running chrome.exe. What is the expected result? There must not be any process of chrome.exe. What happens instead? There are some process of chrome.exe. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. Also applies to the link in "Clear Browsing Data" dialog. In order to quit Chrome properly, reopen Chrome's window and choose [Exit] from wrench menu. On WinXP, the link won't be shown in "Content Settings" dialog. PLS see Issue 34884 and Issue 34912.

title.$t: JavaScript blocked notification icon doesn't appear when the page reloads

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Navigate to https://chrome.google.com/extensions 2. Go to Wrench > Options > Under the hood > Content Settings > JavaScript 3. Select do not allow any site to run JavaScript - JavaScript is not really blocked on the webpage but the notification icon appears 4. Reload the webpage What is the expected output? There should be a notification icon in the omnibox for blocked JavaScript What do you see instead? JavaScript gets blocked but there's no notification icon Google Chrome 5.0.317.2 (Official Build 38193)

title.$t: Dialog windows need correct localized sizes

content.$t: Chrome Version : 5.0.317.2 (Build 38193) dev URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: Firefox 3.x: IE 7: IE 8: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open 'Parameters' window. 2. Go to the last tab. 3. Push 'Content settings' button. 4. Move to 'plug-ins' tab. 5. Push 'Exceptions...' button. What is the expected result? Nice rendering =) What happens instead? 'Close' button moved under 'remove all' button Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: Screeching sound at beginning of audio for <audio> tag

content.$t: Chrome Version : 5.0.307.5 dev URLs : http://aolradio.podcast.aol.com/aolmusic/mp3s/The_Mynabirds_Numbers _Dont_Lie_128.mp3 http://aolradio.podcast.aol.com/aolmusic/mp3s/Ortolan_Sticky_Situation_ 128.mp3 OS version : OSX 10.6.2 Behavior in Safari 3.x/4.x (if applicable): OK Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): OK Behavior in Chrome for Windows: FAIL What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to either of the URLs above 2. Chrome audio player will start playing the file 3. Make sure Chrome audio player (not quicktime) plays the file What is the expected result? The audio should start playing normally What happens instead? Before the file starts playing, there is a screeching sound that lasts about a second

title.$t: [Content Settings - Cookies] Unfriendly error messages are shown for extensions when "Block sites from setting any data"

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Install several extensions like aniWeather, Cooliris, etc 2. Set the "Block sites from setting any data" in "Content Settings" --> "Cookies" 3. Close and then relaunch chrome What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Different kind of unfriendly error messages are shown like "Error: QUOTA_EXCEEDED_ERR: DOM Exception 22", "SmoothScroll: Please restart chrome" and etc. These are really confusing to users as a result they don't know what happened to their chrome. Chrome should show some meaningful and friendly message so that users could resolve their problems. Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: [Content Settings - Images] The button icons/images of inspector should not be blocked when check "Do not show any images"

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Check "Do not show any images" from "Content Settings" --> "Images" 2. Launch Inspector(Developer Tools) What is the expected output? What do you see instead? All the button icons/images are blocked, but since the inspector tool is a system built-in feature, it should not be blocked. Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

content.$t:

title.$t: Browser crash @ adding content settings exceptions.

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.1.249.1011 (Official Build 39069) URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: Firefox 3.x: IE 7: IE 8: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. launch Chrome 2. click Wrench => Options => Content settings => Exceptions... 3. click "Add" button 4. enter any site on "Host:" field,(ex: www.youtube.com), then click "OK" 5. close and reopen Chrome 6. Check the "Exceptions" list which is created from step #4 What is the expected result? What happens instead? - "Chrome crash" dialog boxes appear after closing Chrome. (crash.png) - There is no exception website saved on "xxx Exceptions" dialog box Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: Cookie Settings : Chrome crashes when changes are made to cookie settings

content.$t: This bug has been found on: Windows Vista Chrome browser version: Google Chrome :5.0.332.0 (Official build 39309 )beta WebKit : 533.1 V8 : 2.1.0.1 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Goto Chrome->Options from Wrench Menu 2.Goto Under the hood->Privacy Content Settings->Cookies 3.Select "Ask Me If a site tries to set Data" 4.Close Chrome options .Now open any site msn.com ,click on some links http://today.msnbc.msn.com/id/35459745/ns/today-today_food_and_wine? GT1=43001 http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/35460268/ns/us_news-life?GT1=43001 5. You see an alert saying "this site wants to set a cookie on your computer : i) remember my choice for all cookies from this site ii) Ask me every time 6. Select Ask me every time 7. Again goto some other links within the site : msn.com Repeat step # 5 many times ,alternating between both options What is the expected output? Both options must work correctly for cookie settings What do you see instead? Chrome crashes if we click any of the options : i) remember my choice for all cookies from this site ii) Ask me every time Please use labels and text to provide additional information. This issue also reproducible also on Windows XP on same build and seen only in windows

title.$t: GCF unreliably switches on the meta tag on first navigation

content.$t: ChromeFrame version: trunk build, Feb 25th. Steps to reproduce the issue: 1. Close IE 6 and relaunch it, 2. load google.com as your home page 3. from a link in the bookmarks toolbar, navigate to a small page containing the GCF meta tag. 4. Observe that rendering in GCF happens unreliably at best What do you expect to happen? Rendering the page in GCF Note that if the page uses the GCF HTTP header instead, rendering is reliably detected and switched.

title.$t: ChromeFrame uninstall can remove some Google Chrome registration entries.

content.$t: Steps to reproduce the issue: 1. Install Google Chrome 2. Install Chrome Frame 3. Uninstall Chrome Frame What do you expect to happen? No Chrome reg entries are removed. What do you see instead? Some Chrome reg entries are removed, e.g. Software\Microsoft\MediaPlayer\ShimInclusionList

title.$t: Request with querystring from href sometimes fires twice.

content.$t: ChromeFrame version: <from cf:about:version> 5.0.317.0 (Official Build 38070) Related URL(s): http://testbed.nicon.nl/googlechrome/testcase_googlechrome.asp Steps to reproduce the issue: 1. just click the links in the page from the related URL 2. 3. What do you expect to happen? The counter in the page from the related URL should increment or decrement with 1. What do you see instead? Sometimes the request fires twice, so the value is incremented/decremented with 2

title.$t: Content settings exception doesn't work

content.$t: Platform: Hostname: testings-mac-mini-3.local Mac OS X Version 10.6.2 (Build 10C540) Processor: 4 Intel 2.66 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chrome: Chrome version: 5.0.342.1 r40461 <<<Release/Debug>>> QuickTime Player: <unknown> QuickTime PlayerX: 90.3.1 Flash Player: 10.0.45.2 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open Preferences > Under the Hood > Content settings > Images dialog. 2. Block images for yahoo.com from exception. Expected result: 2.1 Images from yahoo.com are blocked by Chrome. Actual result: 2.2 Chrome still shows images on yahoo.com. Note: - This is same for plugins, java script, Cookies...

title.$t: Need UMA stats on default search engine

content.$t:
We're going to be doing some experiments on the search engine selection 
screen (http://crbug.com/37564) so we need to measure which search engine has 
been chosen by the user. We'll need to correlate this with an experimental 
group in the case that the user is getting a different search engine 
selection UI.

title.$t: REGRESSION: Visual Defect / Gray Bar on Frame and Superbar on Windows 7 and Vista Aero

content.$t: Chrome Version : 5.0.351.0 (41182) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Start Chromium 2. 3. What is the expected result? No extraneous structure overlaping the superbar and aero frame. What happens instead? See the attachment Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: REGRESSION: Fullscreen mode does not size Aero glass frame correctly

content.$t:
I just tested a trunk build, and fullscreen mode does not properly size and 
position the glass frame properly.  There's glitchy drawing around the window 
edges.

title.$t: REGRESSION: Gears logo is missing in gears settings dialog

content.$t:
Go to Wrench > Options > under the hood > Change Gears settings

Issue: Gears logo is missing

Please see the attached image

Google Chrome	5.0.360.0 (Official Build 42309)

title.$t: REGRESSION: Gears settings dialog goes blank when trying to remove an entry

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Navigate to reader.google.com and login 2. Click on green arrow 3. Click on Never Allow this site 4. Go to Wrench > Options > Under the Hood > Change Gears settings 5. In gears dialog, click on Remove What is the expected output? Apply button should be enabled What do you see instead? Gears settings dialog goes blank Google Chrome 5.0.360.0 (Official Build 42309) Please see the attached image

title.$t: TLS (thread local storage) callbacks are not called in Windows official builds (with whole program optimization)

content.$t: Chrome Version : 5.0.366.2 (Official Build 43280) unknown What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Run chrome.exe with the --use-spdy=npn command-line option. 2. Do a Google search. 3. Shut down Chrome. What is the expected output? All chrome.exe processes should exit. What do you see instead? Windows Task Manager shows a chrome.exe process is still running. Mike, Will, can you reproduce this bug?

title.$t: Chrome crashes when change option after adding start up URLs

content.$t:
[Environment]
Google Chrome	5.0.371.0 (Official Build 43900) unknown
WebKit	533.4
V8	2.2.1
User Agent	Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US) 
AppleWebKit/533.4 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/5.0.371.0 Safari/533.4

[Steps]
1. Client A and B are already signed into sync
2. Client A : Add bookmarks (ex. BM1, BM2, BM3......)
3. Client A and B : Go to Option>Basics tab>"On Startup:" options
4. Client A : Select "open the following pages" radio button and Add some 
bookmarks (ex. three to five BMs)
5. Client A : select the "Open the home page" button
6. Repeat Step 4 and 5

title.$t: Crash when double clicking on the 'Address' label in the AutoFill dialog box

content.$t: Chrome Version : 6.0.450.3 URLs (if applicable) : N/A Other browsers tested: N/A What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Options > Personal Stuff > AutoFill options > Add Addresses... 2. Add a profile to the Add an Address dialog box > Save 3. When you are back in the AutoFill Options dialog box you will see the newly created profile. Double click on the label, Address, above the new profile you just added. You will get a crash.

title.$t: Content Settings Exception dialog table headers have wrong width

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to options->content settings->exceptions (choose a content setting where you don't have any exceptions, i.e. where the table is empty) What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The table header should be readable. Instead, its width is way too small. build-bisect.py says this started happening with http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=51628

Issue: Scrollbars color is not appealing. Please see the attached image.

Google Chrome	6.0.472.0 (Official Build 53024)

title.$t: REGRESSION: Proxy server authentication doesn't work after restarting the browser

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open Internet properties > Connections > Lan settings 2. Check the option for proxy server and enter the server name and port number 3. Save the settings 4. Load www.google.com - Authentication is required at this point 5. Enter username and password - Loads the page 6. Restart the browser 7. Repeat steps 4 and 5 What is the expected output? Authentication should work and google.com should load What do you see instead? Authentication fails Works fine with 5.0.375.99 Fails with Google Chrome 6.0.472.0 (Official Build 53024)

title.$t: Regression - Inconsistently reopening a recently closed window results in an invisible window

content.$t: Chrome Version : 6.0.484.0 canary build (it also happened with the 472 branch and maybe even a few releases prior to it) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open a few tabs. 2. Open a new window and open a few tabs in it. 3. Close the new window. 4. Press Ctrl+Shift+T. What is the expected result? The closed window will is visibly reopened. What happens instead? The closed window is invisibly reopened, with no way to interact with it, or see it. It also shows up in the (Chrome) Task Manager - double clicking on one of the tabs there will act like it opens something (the Task Manager loses focus), but you cannot see it or do anything with it. Pressing Alt+Tab will suddenly show more Chrome icons. If you focus on the Task manager again and press Alt+Tab, one less Chrome icon is shown. Double clicking on that tab again, the Task Manager will lose focus and Alt+Tab again will show more Chrome icons.

content.$t:
ENVIRONMENT
Google Chrome	7.0.514.0 (Offizieller Build 58434)
WebKit	534.7
V8	2.4.0
User-Agent	Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US) AppleWebKit/534.7 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/7.0.514.0 Safari/534.7
Befehlszeile	... --user-data-dir=C:\datadirs\7.0.514.0_dev_Win_B1 --enable-log --log-level=0 --lang=de

REPRO STEPS
0. Start with two clients, both signed into sync with the same account;
1. Both clients: Open about:sync and validate that the Updates Received count is the same between the two clients; 
2. Client A: Open Wrench -> Options -> AutoFill Options and then close it. 3. Both clients: Check the about:sync Updates Received count.

ACTUAL RESULTS
Just opening and closing the AutoFill dialog generates 3 (!) updates that we sync.

EXPECTED RESULTS
No updates should be generated, if there are no syncable actions.

ADDITIONAL INFO
For comparison - any actually syncable action generates a single (1) update.

title.$t: New windows opened within ChromeFrame in full tab mode don't use the host network stack

content.$t:
If a page rendered within ChromeFrame issues a window.open call which results 
in a new window being opened, you can see that this window opens as a regular 
chrome window and not a window within the host browser.

Importantly network requests issued by this window will go through the Chrome 
network stack, which means sessions opened by the main page will not be 
reused.

title.$t: Need to pump events in the renderer when the browser might be showing a cookie prompt during a synchronous IPC

content.$t:
Need to pump events in the renderer when the browser might be showing a 
cookie prompt during a synchronous IPC

Cases where this could happen:
1- reading document.cookie
2- sending a synchronous XHR request
3- accessing localstorage

If we don't pump events, then we could end up deadlocking the browser.  For 
example, the browser's UI thread could be blocked on a plugin's UI thread, 
which could in turn be blocked trying to script the page (sync IPC to the 
webkit thread).  If the webkit thread is meanwhile blocked waiting for the 
browser UI to show the user a prompt, we could be stuck.

title.$t: Using Web Inspector on an element in a page where JS is blocked crashes the renderer

content.$t:
Turn on JavaScript blocking (Options->page 3->Content Settings->JavaScript-
>toggle radio button).  Go to any external page (e.g. google.com).  Right-
click inspect some element.

The renderer crashes.  It looks like the issue is in 
DebuggerAgentImpl::createUtilityContext(), where we ask for 
V8Proxy::context(frame) -- this triggers an ASSERT() in V8.

For --disable-javascript, we just disabled the Web Inspector too.  But for 
our new content settings, we've been trying to make "internal" parts of 
Chrome, e.g. Chrome UI pages and extensions, continue to work even with JS 
disabled elsewhere.

One part of this is that we whitelist script on URLs with certain schemes, 
e.g. chrome:// and chrome-internal://.  If there is a set of URLs connected 
to the Dev Tools I need to add to the whitelist, that's feasible.  
Otherwise, perhaps the problem is somewhat like one Matt fixed for 
extensions at http://codereview.chromium.org/595001 ?

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Set "Content Settings" -> "Images" -> "Do not show any images" 2. Access any web page which has images 3. Right click on any blocked image and click "Copy image" What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Page crashes with a "Aw,snap" sad tab. Issue is detected in Beta candidate 4.1.249.1011 (Official Build 39069), it also happens in latest trunk 5.0.331.0 (Developer Build 39220) Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: [Content Settings - Pop-ups] Sound/voice/music of pop-up page is still being played even pop-up page is blocked

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to some web page which has a pop-up page that plays sound/voice/music What is the expected output? What do you see instead? This pop-up page is blocked by default, but the sound/voice/music of it is still being played, very annoying and no way to stop them. In previous builds with old pop-up blocking feature, a block bar is displayed on right-bottom corner of browser, in this case we can stop the sound/voice/music by closing the block bar, but now when with blocked notification icon in omnibox, no way to stop them. Issue is detected in Beta candidate 4.1.249.1011 (Official Build 39069), it also happens in latest trunk 5.0.331.0 (Developer Build 39220) Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: Crash during shutdown

content.$t:
This happens on the 249 branch and appears to be because we haven't merged 
r33109 into 249. The HostContentSettingsMap is using keys like 'foo.bar', 
which without patch 33109 are treated as the path 'foo', 'bar' instead of 
'foo.bar'. I attempted the merge but realized there are some patches required 
in addition to 33109. I'm passing to Peter who did the patch in 33109 as he 
should know what other patches need to be added to the mix.

title.$t: [Content Settings - Javascript] Disabling javascript causes extension or plugin crashes

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Make sure you have some extensions installed, like top 20 popular extensions (typically Cooliris). 2. Check "Content Settings" -> "Javascript" -> "Do not allow any site to run Javascript" 3. Access www.google.com What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Due to the extensions you installed, several system error dialogs may popup with message like "Google Chrome has encountered a problem and needs to close...", check screen-shot for reference. Issues happens in Dev candidate 5.0.335.0 (Official Build 39561) but doesn't happen in latest trunk 5.0.336.0 (Developer Build 39601) Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: HTML5 forms validity API not properly implemented for required radio groups

content.$t: Chrome Version : 38071 URLs (if applicable) : http://beta.insightdining.com/surveys/limon Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Opera: OK Safari 4: NOT_IMPLEMENTED Firefox 3.x: NOT_IMPLEMENTED IE 7: NOT_IMPLEMENTED IE 8: NOT_IMPLEMENTED What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create an input group of the type 'radio' with @required set. 2. Check one of the boxes. 3. Call widget.checkValidity() What is the expected result? If any box in the group is checked, the whole control is valid. widget.checkValidity() should return true. What happens instead? widget.checkValidity() always returns false if a radio group is required, and causes document.forms[0].checkValidity() to also return false. It does this even if a button is checked (which defies the spec), or if the button you call it against is checked (which defies logic). Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. From the HTML5 spec: "Constraint validation: If the element is required and all of the input elements in the radio button group have a checkedness that is false, then the element is suffering from being missing." The above link was built over a year ago, based on the draft HTML5 spec, and is now broken in Chrome due to Chrome's recent misimplementation of checkValidity. The box on the right tells you if a question is required. As you answer questions, the page scrolls to the next available question, unless you skipped a required question. As you can see, this works in every browser but Chrome, where it breaks on any required question.

title.$t: WebGL constructors should not be visible to the page unless --enable-webgl is specified

content.$t:
WebGL constructors should not be visible to the page unless --enable-webgl is 
specified

These constructors may be used by websites to check if WebGL is supported by 
the UA, so we should hide them per our usual EnabledAtRuntime mechanism.

It is also important to prevent script from poking at this code since it is 
not a released feature yet.  It may have stability problems, etc.

title.$t: Bookmark Sync can not call BookmarkModel functions on background thread

content.$t:
BookmarkModel should be used only on UI thread

I can find instances of this kind of violation in bookmark sync code. For 
example CreateBookmarkNode calls into BookmarkModel::AddGroup and 
BookmarkModel::AddURL.

const BookmarkNode* BookmarkChangeProcessor::CreateBookmarkNode(
    sync_api::BaseNode* sync_node,
    const BookmarkNode* parent,
    BookmarkModel* model,
    int index) {
  DCHECK(parent);
  DCHECK(index >= 0 && index <= parent->GetChildCount());

  const BookmarkNode* node;
  if (sync_node->GetIsFolder()) {
    node = model->AddGroup(parent, index, sync_node->GetTitle());
  } else {
    node = model->AddURL(parent, index,
                         sync_node->GetTitle(), sync_node->GetURL());
    SetBookmarkFavicon(sync_node, node, model->profile());
  }
  return node;
}

It will be good to check all the callings to BookmarkModel and other 
classes that should be called in UI thread.

title.$t: Visual issues with cookie dialogs

content.$t:
- enable to be prompted on every cookie in cookie settings
- go to cnn.com

here are a few visual issues:
- modal dialog with no icon identifying application. This violates the HIG.
- radio buttons for "enable" state wraps and looks like ass even on the shortest website urls. Radio 
buttons should be written to not wrap.
- ui doesn't match any other yes/no/remember on the OS (which uses a checkbox, not radio 
buttons).

title.$t: The 'extension has been disabled' infobar incorrectly shown

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Load any unpacked extension, foo 2. Install any other extension, bar, normally 3. Disable the bar extension 4. Restart Chrome What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Should see Chrome start without any infobars. Instead, see the infobar "Extension bar has been disabled because it requested more permissions". This is a regression since the addition of the 'remember unpacked extensions across restart' feature. This only happens when an extension is loaded unpacked because in that case, we end up running extension startup code after the browser window has been shown. Typically, we finish extension statup before the first browser window. So even though we do send this notification, nobody receives it.

title.$t: BindToStorageSwitchContent is broken.

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Run chrome_frame_tests.exe --gtest_filter=*BindToStorageSwitchContent 2. 3. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected: [ RUN ] UrlmonMonikerTest.BindToStorageSwitchContent [ OK ] UrlmonMonikerTest.BindToStorageSwitchContent (0 ms) Actual: [ RUN ] UrlmonMonikerTest.BindToStorageSwitchContent C:\b\slave\chromium-rel-builder\build\src\chrome_frame\test\urlmon_moniker_integration_test.cc(270): error: Value of: request_data != NULL Actual: false Expected: true [ FAILED ] UrlmonMonikerTest.BindToStorageSwitchContent (0 ms)

title.$t: html5 video loop property ignored

content.$t: Chrome Version : 5.0.342.7 URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: N/A Firefox 3.x: N/A IE 7: N/A IE 8: N/A (AFAIK Chromium/Google Chrome is the only browser that supports the html5 video loop property.) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create a web page that uses the html5 video tag to play a video and set loop property to true. 2. Prior to the 5.0.342.7 release, the video would play in a continuous loop. 3. With 5.0.342.7 the loop property appears to be ignored. <video width="600" height="400" autobuffer="true" autoplay="true" loop="true" id="video"> <source src="/mov/spaceweather.mp4" type='video/mp4; codecs="avc1.42E01E, mp4a.40.2"'> </video> What is the expected result? Video plays in a continuous loop until the browser page is closed. I use Google Chrome to run a video kiosk. Of the various items on the kiosk page, is a video that should play when the browser loads the page and continues playing until the kiosk shuts down at the end of the day. My workaround for now is to use the html meta tag to force the page to reload every 30 minutes. What happens instead? Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: Install plugin prompts should be bypassed when a plugin is disabled using about:plugins

content.$t: Use internal flash plugin using --enable-internal-flash What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to about:plugins and disable flash 2. Navigate to www.hulu.com What is the expected output? A better info bar saying that the plugin is disabled should be shown. If possible, give an option to enable plugin using that infobar. What do you see instead? Info bar which prompts to install plugin is seen. Google Chrome 5.0.360.4 (Official Build 42897)

title.$t: floating elements with shadows leave artifacts when scrolling

content.$t: Chrome Version : 5.0.307.11-r39572 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to nytimes.com 2. don't close the "times people" floating thing at the top 3. scroll down the page, the back up. What is the expected result? No artifacts. What happens instead? It seems the shadow part never gets redrawn. See the attached screenshots. One is a result of dragging the scrollbar (lots of lines), the other is a result of using the srollwheel (fewer, evenly-spaced lines). Note: I've also seen this with a floating element on the bottom of economsit.com articles.

title.$t: autofill change processor doesn't properly associate ids

content.$t:
It does Associate() on the chrome -> sync path, but when a new node is 
created by sync, there's no call to associate the new ID with the tag.

I believe this would cause an unrecoverable error when an update to this 
node occurs.  This is bad.

title.$t: webkitNotification.checkPermission() is busted for extensions that explicitly requestPermission()

content.$t:
In an attempt to close a previously leak of notification permissions 
extensions that had requested them in the manifest, I short-circuited 
extensions checkPermission() when it was requested explicitly via 
requestPerission.

title.$t: [CF] URLs containing special characters may not load in ChromeFrame

content.$t: ChromeFrame 5.0.375.3 (Official Build 44229) OS: Windows 7 Host browser: IE8 Special characters tested: space (%20) and dash (-). Precondition: ------------- Have ChromeFrame installed. What steps will reproduce the problem? -------------------------------------- 1. In IE, navigate to: http://www.corp.google.com/chromeqa/samples/mberkowitz/chrome- frame/test.htm 2. In IE, navigate to: http://www.corp.google.com/chromeqa/samples/mberkowitz/chrome%20frame/test. htm Web page test.htm has a metatag. Registry method is also affected. Using gcf: is always successful in loading the page. What is the expected output? ---------------------------- Web page test.htm should load. What do you see instead? ------------------------ Web page test.htm is stuck in a loading state. Sometimes, after opening one of these pages, ChromeFrame may get into a state where other pages won't load, either.

title.$t: Incorrect URL and SSL security status indicator in location bar for revoked and invalid certificates

content.$t: This bug is a regression on the trunk and Dev channel. The current Beta channel release "5.0.342.9 (Official Build 43360) beta" works fine. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Visit VeriSign's test site for a revoked certificate: https://test-ssev.verisign.com:2443/test-SSEV-revoked-verisign.html What is the expected output? The location bar should have the URL, and a security status indicator (was a triagular warning icon) showing there is a certificate error. If I click the security status indicator, I should get the Security Information dialog, which allows me to inspect the bad certificate. What do you see instead? The location bar shows the URL and security status indicator of the previous page, so I can't inspect the bad certificate. Clicking the "Back" icon on the SSL interstitial page brings me to the second page back in history. Hint on debugging: Start with the SSLPolicy::OnCertError method in ssl_policy.cc. The two classes of certificate errors diverge from there into OnOverridableCertError(handler) and OnFatalCertError(handler).

title.$t: Unneeded horizontal scrollbar in Gmail

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Goto Google Mail (mail.google.com/a/google.com) 2. Enable Right-Side-Chat Labs 3. Go back to Google Main What is the expected output? What do you see instead? It should be possible to resize the window such that the horizontal scrollbar goes away. Please use labels and text to provide additional information. There is always a horizontal scroll bar. Even when resizing the window much wider, the scrollbar is always 'almost full'. This problem does not occur in Seamonkey 1.1.14. This problem does occur in older versions (release) of Chrome.

title.$t: Gears File Drag and Drop

content.$t:
Add Gears File Drag & Drop support

 1) update webkit/glue/webdropdata with a drag identity, implemented
    as an up-counter in base/base_drop_target and incremented on os-
    level drag enters in tab client areas.

 2) add CPAPI functions for gears; one to extract the drag type/data
    given an NPObject *event and one to control the drop effect (aka
    drag cursor).

     -- gears has the *event as an NPObject; that event
        is untrusted, gears sends the event back to the
        renderer/V8 for checking, type/data extraction.

 3) add NPOject event testing & drag data extraction code, somewhere
    we conveniently have both V8 and NPAPI in one place:
 
       webkit/port/bindings/v8/np_v8object.{h,cc}

    to verify the *event is a valid drag target event, is in browser
    event dispatch, and extract the drag data if so.

 4) add IPC glue calls for the new CPAPIs from the plugin process to
    the renderer, webview changes to control the drop effect.

title.$t: Remove hidden files when packaging extensions

content.$t:
This would let us remove any non-listed files during packaging, for a
smaller file size, and reduced risk of including unwanted content. On the
other hand, it adds some hassle for developers (currently they don't have
to list pages, imgs, css, etc).

Thought prompted by this discussion on chromium-extensions:

http://groups.google.com/group/chromium-extensions/browse_thread/thread/ecd238781ee78bd6?hl=en

"Ignore hidden files and folder when packing extensions:

I often use Google Code + Tortoise SVN to store and retrieve the code
of my extensions and, because TortoiseSVN creates an hidden folder
( .svn ) into each directory, every time I package the extension those
hidden folders are archived inside the .crx file.

That is not what I desire, I would like the packager to strip hidden
file and folders ( maybe a new command line option ? )

Is that possibile?"

title.$t: Extension API inconsistency with ports
Add an options_page to the manifest

content.$t:
There should be a declarative way to specify the options page for an 
extension. Chrome would render UI in the management screen to allow users to 
access this page.

The entry would just point to an HTML page that Chrome would open. No clever 
integration beyond that.

title.$t: browser actions: popup should be able to close itself

content.$t:
The popup code is the only place that really knows when it's done an action 
which should cause it to dismiss.  For simplicity's sake, window.close() 
should just work.

title.$t: Extensions created on OS X won't install

content.$t:
It seems OS X puts in extra junk in the crx.  I think this is a known bug 
but I checked the tracker for this error message and didn't find it:

"Cannot load extension with file or directory name __MACOSX. Filenames 
starting with "_" are reserved for use by the system."

Assigning to aa since I don't know who is the appropriate person for triage.

title.$t: Remove first run sentinel migration code

content.$t:
See reference in file_path.cc to this bug.
The code should be removed after users have been migrated.

title.$t: Remove toolstrips API

content.$t:
Toolstrips are out. We need to remove them by default, but leave them 
supported behind a flag for continued experimentation.

title.$t: Some more UI changes for Beta

content.$t:
I know this is late in the game, but hoping we can squeeze these in:

From Brian Rakowski: "It seems like we're all in agreement that we don't
need to show status for bookmarks sync there. Can we just remove that line
unless there is an error? I'm okay showing errors on the NTP with the red
background bar.

Why don't we indicate more status from the menu option in the Chrome menu?
When syncing is enabled, it could show "Bookmarks synced..." When not
enabled, "Sync my bookmarks...". When there's an error, "Bookmark sync
error..."

Have we settled on a promo for bookmark sync yet? Something like
http://mocks/glen/chrome/spec/76_sync/1/#smaller_promo_1.png?"

I'll let the UI team chime in on the promo.

title.$t: Plugins that crash during initialization hang the entire renderer

content.$t:
So far that I'm aware of, both the Move Networks media player and Shockwave 
for Director hang the render if you visit a page with their content and have 
the plugin installed.

Neither plugin works in Safari on 10.6 in my testing, and we have bugs for 
having real support for them at some point, but we really shouldn't hang the 
whole renderer. Since the same thing happens with multiple plugins, and it's 
on the renderer side, I'm assuming this is a general problem.

Tentatively marking as beta-blocking, since the experience is pretty bad 
(although it may be that the beta solution is just to blacklist any plugin that 
has this problem).

title.$t: Badge background and text colors should be in ARGB format, not RGBA

content.$t:
Note that this is a breaking change, so we should send mail to chromium-
extensions@ when it lands.

title.$t: implement popups for page actions

content.$t:
As part of reconciling page action and browser action APIs (issue 24635), we 
should implement popups for page actions.

title.$t: Add am/sw locale data to ICU

content.$t: For tracking.

title.$t: Various extensions management UI visual nitpickery

content.$t:
* The subtext should be black not grey. Grey denotes disabledness.
* The disable/reload/etc should be top-aligned not middle-aligned.
* The developer tools toggle should remember its state across runs.
* There should be a fade effect on toggling the developer tools.

title.$t: [CF Full Mode] IE menu item: View > Privacy Policy enabled but non-functional

content.$t: Chrome Frame 4.0.223.9 Host browser: IE7, IE8 What steps will reproduce the problem? -------------------------------------- 1. Load a page in CF. 2. From IE menu bar, select View > Web Page Privacy Policy... What is the expected output? ---------------------------- Privacy Report dialog should pop up. What do you see instead? ------------------------ No action.

title.$t: page and browser action default_title should not be required

content.$t: The docs say they are not, but the code is requiring them.

title.$t: chrome.(browser|page)Icon.setIcon({path:...}) scales up small icons

content.$t: It should only resize icons that are too big, not too small.

title.$t: Next/prev buttons and match count flicker while typing in find box

content.$t:
Type text in the find box... note that the next/prev buttons and the match 
count text flicker while typing.

title.$t: Minor code sample typo

content.$t: Chrome Version : Latest HEAD SVN URL : http://src.chromium.org/svn/trunk/src/chrome/common/extensions/docs/api_other.html What steps will reproduce the problem? The 4nd line of the code sample in "WebKit APIs" section has 'sl' as the duration of the transition. What is the expected result? It should be '1s': -webkit-transition: all 1s ease-out;

title.$t: Group extensions on chrome://extensions page

content.$t:
On the chrome://extensions page, we currently list extensions
alphabetically. I think we should split them into three groups:

* unpacked extensions at the top (in active development)
* other active extensions next
* disabled extensions at the bottom

We should also add section headers to distinguish these (ask Kansinee for
mocks). This will make the list more usable for both developers and users.

title.$t: Make sure all strings in chrome://extensions are i18n-able

content.$t:
All strings should be read from resources files so they can be sent to
translation.

title.$t: Disabled extensions don't show an icon in the management ui page

content.$t:
I presume we can't ask the extension to give us its png file when the 
extension is disabled, but I haven't looked.

title.$t: Change the default location of content script injection

content.$t:
Right now we always inject content scripts in DOMContentLoaded. This affects 
page load time and many content scripts do not really need to be run so 
early.

We should add a new location like "IDLE" that injects as soon as layout is 
idle for 10-20ms.

title.$t: Don't reload extensions management page to refresh

content.$t:
Right now we are being lazy and refreshing the management page whenever the 
loaded extensions change. We should instead just modify the DOM.

Raf tells me that this should be really easy. We should be able to just 
rebuild the JSON data and send it into the same init() function that we call 
on startup and it JSTemplate should just rebuild the DOM magically.

title.$t: Center badges better

content.$t:
When the badge is an odd number of pixels wide and the icon is an even number 
(or vice versa), the badge looks funny.

We should force the badge to be have the same odd/even-ness as the icon, by 
adding 1px to its right extent when necessary.

This will make the padding around the text uneven, but it is harder to notice 
since the text doesn't have as script of a line on the right side.

See attached mocks.

title.$t: The +/i icon next to "Developer Tools" should be 1 or 2 px more to the left

content.$t:
See attached.

Also, the text "Developer Tools" should have the style "cursor:default" to 
make it use the normal arrow instead of the text i-beam.

title.$t: Renderer hang when using www.expedia.com

content.$t: Platform: Hostname: RohMac-2.local Mac OS X Version 10.5.8 (Build 9L30) Processor: 2 Intel 2.40 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chromium: Chromium version: 4.0.232.0 SVN Revision: 30678 <<<Release/Debug>>> QuickTime Player: 7.6.4 QuickTime PlayerX: <unknown> Flash Player: 10.0.32 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to http://www.expedia.com/. 2. Enter 'to' and 'from' and dates details and click on 'search for flights'. 3. Wait till flights list appears. 4. Select any flight and continue. 5. Press back button and scroll flights list. Expected result: 5.1 Chrome scrolls flights list page. Actual result: 5.2 Renderer hangs. Note: - Mac safari works fine. - I have attached Chrome sample file.

title.$t: User scripts not installed depending on download settings

content.$t:
User scripts will not be installed, if "Ask where to save each file before 
downloading" is checked at Options > Under the Hood > Downloads.

In that case, confirmation of install is not displayed on the Download shelf,
and the *.user.js file is just downloaded as a file.
Tested with Developer Build 31081 on WinXP.

title.$t: need to differentiate crashes from extension processes

content.$t:
There needs to be a way to distinguish extension process crashes from normal 
renderer crashes so that we can understand the effect of extensions on 
stability.

Probably the easiest way to do this would be to add a new ptype - that way 
the crash backend doesn't need to change its reporting as much.

title.$t: add more extension information to crash reports

content.$t:
In addition to distinguishing extension processes from normal renderers 
(issue 27163), we should look into adding more extension information into the 
crash report itself in order to help us understand the impact of extensions 
on stability:
- adding the extension id of the process into the extension process crash 
report
- adding the list of extension id's to browser process crashes

See also issue 27165 (adding the list of extension id's which have injected 
content scripts into a renderer that crashed).

title.$t: Produce and include 4/5 more samples in the site

content.$t: It'd be nice to add some additional samples to our documentation.

title.$t: Disable --enable-user-scripts

content.$t:
They have been replaced by automatic conversion of user scripts to 
extensions.

title.$t: Extra quotes in manifest sample on extensions getting started page

content.$t:
There is an extra set of quotes in the sample manifest.json on this page:

http://code.google.com/chrome/extensions/getstarted.html

title.$t: The puzzle piece promo should not go away when the text promo is closed

content.$t:
Currently, when the "x" in the yellow textual promo on the NTP is clicked, 
both the yellow bar and the puzzle piece in the right corner go away.

This doesn't seem right to me. Besides being visually jarring, I like the 
look of the puzzle piece, but not the yellow bar. I feel like every version 
of Chromium should just have a different little effect there that sticks 
around for the whole version.

OTOH, I do remember some people complaining about the theme promo. Is that 
why this behavior was added?

title.$t: Sync promo should point at sync install flow

content.$t:
From Brian: "I think we should launch the feature from the promo, just like we do when you choose 
the "Synchronize my bookmarks..." menu option."'

title.$t: Sample extensions use innerHTML

content.$t:
A few of the sample extensions use innerHTML. They shouldn't, this is bad 
practice and shouldn't be encouraged.

title.$t: Sample extensions use toolstrips

content.$t:
There are two sample extensions that still contain references to 
"toolstrips". Not sure if the code is active, but it should be removed one 
way or the other.

title.$t: Extensions docs issue

content.$t:
In the this page: 
http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome/trunk/src/chrome/common/extensions/docs
/samples.html

it says "Note: To run these samples, you need to be using the Dev or Beta 
channel of Google Chrome."

Surely that should be "Note: To run these samples, you need to be using the 
Dev channel of Google Chrome." (without the beta)

title.$t: Uninstalling extension should prompt user to remove any persistent data

content.$t: Chrome Version: 4.0.245.0 The localStorage data appears to persist across extension uninstalls. It seems like that data should be cleaned up during the uninstall. To verify: - Install an extension with a background.html page - From chrome://extensions/, inspect the background.html view and open the console - Add a new value with "localStorage.setItem('test', 'dummy value');" - Uninstall the extension (optionally restart Chrome, the issue persists across restarts as well) - Reinstall the extension - Head back to the console for that background.html view and check out your previously saved entry with "localStorage.getItem('test');" URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: Firefox 3.x: IE 7: IE 8: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. 2. 3. What is the expected result? What happens instead? Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: Remove the duplicate sync promo on the NTP

content.$t:
We now have two sync promos on the NTP, we should only keep the new one.

Related: do we change the promo text when sync is enabled? how about when an extension has 
been installed?

title.$t: Vertical separator bar in docs should be green

content.$t:
See:
http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome/trunk/src/chrome/common/extensions/docs
/bookmarks.html

The bar that separates the nav from the content should be green.

title.$t: Change docs to mark default_icons as mandatory for PageActions and BrowserActions

content.$t:
We won't enforce this for now so as not to break existing extensions, but we want to make it clear 
that developers should include this going forward.

title.$t: Merge in noteworthy patches for 249

content.$t: 249 branched WebKit@50972. We need to cherry-pick good stuffs.

title.$t: Partial content bug

content.$t:
Launch IE with ChromeFrame installed.
Navigate to timesofindia.com
Observe that the throbber continues to spin.

Navigate to tennisballcricket.org
Observe that a blank page shows up at times while the throbber continues to
spin.

In these cases we get OnDataAvailable notifications from Urlmon on our bind 
status callback but no data. Eventually the request gets stopped however 
Chrome continues to wait forever for the request to finish.

title.$t: Theme format on disk depends on IDR resource numbers.

content.$t: Chrome 5.0.307.1 (Official Build 37331) dev What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Install Chrome 4.0.302.3(Official Build 36935) dev [latest dev channel release build] 2. Install any theme 3. Overinstall Chrome 5.0.307.1 (Official Build 37331) dev 4. Open New tab page What is the expected output? no layout issue What do you see instead? New tab page layout and repaint issues. Screenshot_ntp : If you have any theme installed and launch ntp Screenshot_ntp2 : If you have any theme installed and then install classic theme. Above issue "not" reproducible if it is a fresh install or if no theme is installed or if under options >personal stuff - use classic theme button is clicked. Please use labels and text to provide additional information. Screenshots:

title.$t: Add plumbing to support forcing a cookie to a session cookie

content.$t:
Add plumbing to support forcing a cookie to a session cookie from the cookie 
prompt.

title.$t: Show blocked cookie icon when cookies are blocked.

content.$t:
Show blocked cookie icon when cookies/localstorage/databases are blocked.

We probably need to do this on the IO thread upon completion of querying the 
CookiePolicy so that we can associate the policy with the correct tab 
contents.

title.$t: Connect cookies, localstorage, and database to the cookie prompt

content.$t: Connect cookies, localstorage, and database to the cookie prompt

title.$t: Do not offer to translate languages listed in the Languages options dialog

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open the "Font and Language settings..." dialog from UTH 2. Add a language to the list on the languages tab 3. Go to a page in that language What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The browser shouldn't offer to translate the page but it does.

title.$t: Translate infobar shouldn't disappear and reappear when translating

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to a page in a language you don't speak (lemonde.fr) 2. Choose "Translate" on the Translate infobar Notice that the infobar disappears and then reappears once the translating finishes. Instead, we should replace the "Translate" and "Nope" buttons to "Translating..." and then, once the page is translated, change the text to the "Page has been translated" text WITHOUT hiding/showing the bar. NOTE: We probably don't have "translating..." as a string. One option would be to use "loading..." for the initial release.

title.$t: Inconsistent bookmarks syncing when deleting large set of bookmarks

content.$t: Platform: Hostname: RohMac-2.local Mac OS X Version 10.5.8 (Build 9L30) Processor: 2 Intel 2.40 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chrome: Chrome version: 5.0.322.0 r38504 <<<Release>>> QuickTime Player: 7.6.4 QuickTime PlayerX: <unknown> Flash Player: 10.0.42 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Have a large set of bookmarks (includes 4-5 steps of sub folder hierarchy and many bookmarks) in Chrome running on machine A. 2. Sync bookmarks using any gmail account. 3. Sync another two machines B and C using same gmail account. -> We have now machine A, B and C synced with same gmail account and have same set of bookmarks. 4. Delete a bookmarks folder (which has large set of sub-folders) from BMB (right click and delete). 5. Immediately on machine B, create 2-3 bookmarks inside the same folder (which we deleted in the step 4). Deletion sync of folder which we deleted in step 4 will not happen immediately on machine B. 6. Perform step#5 2-3 times. 7. Verify bookmarks on machine B and C. Result: We are getting inconsistent results for above test: - Folder gets recreated on machine A. - Syncing failed on Machine A, B, C, so any changes on any machine doesn't sync on another machine. - We also got a crash and have filed a separate Issue 35412 for that.

title.$t: Use the google translate icon  in the translation infobar

content.$t:
For official chrome builds, we should use the google translate icon rather 
than the one with the blue background--we can use the current icon for 
chromium builds

title.$t: dual translate infobars showing simultaneously

content.$t:
Chrome Version: 5.0.317.2 dev
URL - www.google.co.jp
Steps to reproduce
- 1. load page
- 2. translate page
- 3. refresh page
- 4. translate page again

You get two infobars showing simultaneously instead of just seeing the "page 
translated" version.

title.$t: Translate infobar shows the wrong language for some pages

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? Open https://bugs.webkit.org/attachment.cgi?id=34167&action=review in Chrome English. Expected: No translate infobar is shown. Actual: A translate infobar reporting the page is in Slovak is shown. Alternative steps: Try with a very short page, for example <html>hello</html> the page is reported to be in Danish

title.$t: Decide what to do with the XSS auditor in the current beta

content.$t:
Issue 35723 describes how POST operations get a lot slower when the XSS auditor is active.

abarth improved the situation for the specific test in that bug from "a lot slower" to "'only' 400% 
slower than chrome 3".

Now, the test in that bug is not representative from normal-day usage. Then again we don't have 
any tests that do POST requests, so we don't really know how bad 400% worse performance is in 
practice.

What should happen on 5.0?

* Merge abarth's patch and swallow the 400% ("Hey, it's much better than chrome 4")
* Disable the xss auditor on 5.0 (as fast as chrome 3, but less xss auditing takes place).

Discuss.

See issue 36929 for the same discussion for 4.1.

title.$t: Line returns in string resources don't work

content.$t:
When we try to display a string resource with \n in it, the \n is displayed 
literally rather than being translated to a line return.

For example, this comes up in the external protocol dialog.

title.$t: regression : spy icon in incognito window has blue bg color instead of gray

content.$t: Chrome 4.0.206.0 (Official Build 25285) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Launch incognito window What is the expected output? no issue What do you see instead? the spy icon on top left has blue bg color instead of gray Please use labels and text to provide additional information. Screenshot :

title.$t: REGRESSION: "Aw, snap" page cropped

content.$t: See screenshot.

title.$t: tab flashes when you start dragging it

content.$t:
case 1:
1. start dragging a tab within the tabstrip (don't drag it out of the 
tabstrip)
2. When the drag initiates the tab flashes (i.e. it appears that it fails 
to paint right away)
3. this doesn't happen on windows.

case 2:
1. drag a tab down, out of the tabstrip
2. notice that you can see the tab being painted over the course of ~300ms 
or so (instead of all appearing at once, you see the tab first, then the 
main window area later). We maybe need to double-buffer?
3. this doesn't happen on windows.
4. I can't see this on my warp station, but it is noticeable on slow 
computers.

related (?): sometimes you can also see a flash in the upper left corner of 
the screen

title.$t: Tab dragging animations broken/janky

content.$t:
Start dragging a tab horizontally within the tabstrip. The other tabs seem to 
"snap" out of the way rather than animating smoothly. This is a regression 
since it used to work afaict.

title.$t: Remove printing flag

content.$t: We should turn it on by default and let users flush out the problems.

title.$t: Copy-and-paste from pidgin ignores non-ASCII characters

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.222.5 (Versão oficial 28804) URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; pt-BR; rv:1.9.1.3) Gecko/20091007 Ubuntu/9.10 (karmic) Firefox/3.5.3 Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: Firefox 3.x: OK IE 7: IE 8: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Using Chrome, go to Google Docs and create a new document 2. Using Firefox, go to a site with accented characters (ex: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diacritic) 3. Copy the text using Firefox and paste in Google Doc's document in Chrome What is the expected result? The text should be pasted "as is" Doc's document. What happens instead? The accented characters are not copied. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. The interesting is that the copy and paste works fine in Gmail and in other text fields like the address bar, for instance.

title.$t: Linux about box is ugly

content.$t:
The about box has:

- bold font face - there should be no bold anywhere in this dialog
- font size for about text is too small. should be standard dialog text font 
size.
- spacing is weird below and above the about text. Compare to Windows or Mac 
for better spacing examples.

Throwing to estade since erg is helping with Mac right now.

title.$t: Test distribution compatibility with seccomp sandbox

content.$t:
Markus wrote: "- testing compatibility with more distributions. I have done 
some work for that the last week or so, and I am quite happy that things 
actually look quite good."

We should check off all the distros we claim to support.

title.$t: Implement performance fixes for gettimeofday() for seccomp sandbox

content.$t:
Markus says: "performance fixes for gettimeofday(). I have had these ready 
for a while, I just need to clean up the code a little bit, have it 
reviewed, and then check it in. This was pending on a few other changelists, 
but those are now submitted."

title.$t: Intercept the RDTSC instruction in the seccomp sandbox

content.$t:
Markus says: "we currently don't intercept the RDTSC instruction, but 
instead rely on the SEGV handler to emulate it for us. This is potentially 
expensive and can result in kernel log files getting flooded. This is only a 
problem for some kernel versions (none of the ones that we use, I think), 
but we should probably still try to fix it before turning the code on for 
all of our users."

title.$t: Make seccomp and setuid sandboxes run together

content.$t:
Markus says: "it would be great if we could run both the seccomp sandbox and 
the suid sandbox, if both of them are available. I think, this mostly just 
works, except for the seccomp sandbox temporarily needed access to some 
files in /proc. But we could pass in those file handles."

title.$t: Status bubble does not scurry out of the way of mouse

content.$t:
Open a google spreadsheet with multiple sheets.
Try to click on the sheet selector at the bottom while the status bubble is 
still saying "Waiting for spreadsheets.google.com"

Note that you can't because the status bubble is blocking them. On Windows, 
the status bubble moves out of the way of the mouse.

ReleaseBlock-Beta since this makes some spreadsheets unusable for long 
periods.

title.$t: 64bit rpm requiring 32bit libs

content.$t: Chrome Version : google-chrome-unstable-4.0.245.1-31796.x86_64 OS + version : Fedora 12 CPU architecture (32-bit / 64-bit): 64bit Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): no 32bit deps What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. rpm -q --requires google-chrome-unstable What is the expected result? rpmlib(VersionedDependencies) <= 3.0.3-1 libasound.so.2()(64bit) libcairo.so.2()(64bit) libgconf-2.so.4()(64bit) libnss3.so()(64bit) libpangocairo-1.0.so.0()(64bit) libsqlite3.so.0()(64bit) xdg-utils /bin/sh /bin/sh /bin/sh /bin/sh rpmlib(PayloadFilesHavePrefix) <= 4.0-1 rpmlib(CompressedFileNames) <= 3.0.4-1 What happens instead? lsb >= 3.2 libasound.so.2 libcairo.so.2 libgconf-2.so.4 libnss3.so >= 3.12.3 <--- !version here looks like nonsense! libpangocairo-1.0.so.0 libsqlite3.so.0 xdg-utils /bin/sh /bin/sh /bin/sh /bin/sh rpmlib(PayloadFilesHavePrefix) <= 4.0-1 rpmlib(CompressedFileNames) <= 3.0.4-1 Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot and backtrace if possible. Using %{_isa} might help a bit.

title.$t: Reduce niceness on background tabs

content.$t:
According to this bug
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/manpages/+bug/468518
on Ubuntu programs can renice themselves up to nice level zero.

If we could detect we're on a system configured this way we could properly 
deprioritize background tabs.

title.$t: Need to implement page action popups on linux

content.$t:
We seem to have forgotten this. Hopefully mostly copying from the browser 
action implementation.

title.$t: sometimes autocomplete popups have blank white areas

content.$t:
If I have text in input field with some autocomplete entries and I backspace 
so I would get more matches, the bottom part of the popup is blank (i.e., 
paints white).

I bet the render widget popup is getting resized and we're not resizing the 
widget.  I think I assumed that popups can't get resized.

title.$t: Regression :  Page encoding cannot be displayed properly on the Encoding list

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.295.0 (Official Build 35884) stable URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: Firefox 3.x: IE 7: IE 8: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. launch Chrome 2. go to http://yahoo.co.kr 3. click "Control the current page" => Encoding... 4. Check the page encoding 5. open new tab and then go to http://yahoo.co.jp 6. check the encoding from "Control the current page => Encoding... " What is the expected result? "Korean" should be marked for yahoo.co.kr "Unicode(UTF-8)" should be marked for yahoo.co.jp What happens instead? - For http://yahoo.co.kr, Unicode(UTF-8) and Korean are selected on the Encoding list. (image Encoding_Ko.png) - For http://yahoo.co.jp, Unicode(UTF-8) and Korean are marked on the Encoding list. (image Encoding_jp.png) Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. I checked some websites such as sina.com.cn, kooora.com, naver.com and they have the same encoding problem.

title.$t: Implement translate infobars on Linux

content.$t: Like it says on the tin.

title.$t: [Content Settings] Cookies expires date is not set correctly when accept it from set cookie prompt in Linux

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Set "Content Settings" -> "Cookies" -> ""Ask me when a site tries to set data" and clear cookie exception list and saved cookies 2. Access http://www.google.com, the set cookie prompt should pop up 3. Click on "Show details" to make sure the Expires field is a date later than now 4. Check "Ask me every time" and then click Allow 5. Go to saved cookies list and check the cookie expires date What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The cookies expires date is "When I close my browser", this is wrong. This issue only happens in Linux, it doesn't happen in Windows. Issue is detected with build 5.0.375.28 (Official Build 45883) in Ubuntu8.04. Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: Linux fixes to "Open on startup" table

content.$t:
See bug 43259 for changes on Windows.  In summary:
* Table content should be favicon + title
* Hovering an item should show "title - URL" as a tooltip
* Layout in RTL UI should be mirrored as you would expect

content.$t: Chrome Version : 0.1 (Developer Build), WebKit 530.9, V8 1.2.2.1 URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: OK Firefox 3.x: OK What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Try to open any resource hosted on a bonjour (.local) domain. What is the expected result? Actual resource. What happens instead? This webpage is not available. Error 108 (net::ERR_ADDRESS_INVALID): Unknown error. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. Screenshot is attached.

title.$t: Autocomplete focus is not maintained across tab switching.

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. browse to www.google.com. Focus should end up in the on-page search box. 2. Bring up a new tab. Start typing in autocomplete field. 3. Click back to www.google.com tab. Focus should still be in search box. 4. Click back to new tab. What you typed (and autocompleted section) should be present, but the previously-selected text is not selected, and the field does not have focus. It is expected that you would end up with the field exactly as it was when you left, except that the popup would no longer be present (it would popup when you start typing).

title.$t: Downloading a file from a link would open a new tab which cannot be closed.

content.$t: Platform: Mac OS X Version 10.5.6 (Build 9G55) Processor: 2 Intel 2.33 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chrome: Chrome version: 182.1 Release QuickTime Player: 7.6 Flash Player: 10.0.22.87 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. The link below downloads a pdf and also opens an Untitled tab. http://zanottos.com/menus/Zanottos_Lunch_Order.pdf What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected: We should be able to close the Untitled tab. Actual: Cannot close the tab. The only way to close this tab is by quitting the browser.

title.$t: "Copy image" does not work

content.$t: Chrome Version : 3.0.182.4 OS version : 10.5.7 Behavior in Safari 3.x/4.x (if applicable): OK Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): OK What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open any image or page containing an image. 2. Right-click the image and select "Copy image" 3. Switch to any image-editing application and attempt to paste the image. What is the expected result? The image should pasted. What happens instead? Nothing. The clipboard does not contain the image.

title.$t: "On startup: Restore the pages that were open last" restores closed windows

content.$t: Chrome Version : 3.0.182.5 OS version : 10.5.7 Behavior in Safari 3.x/4.x (if applicable): Only restores windows open at quit Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): Only restores windows open at quit Behavior in Chrome for Windows: N/A (closing last window quits app) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Launch Chrome 2. Chrome> Preferences, Basics tab, Set "On startup" to "Restore the pages that were open last", close Preferences 3. Enter www.google.com in the Omnibox, <return>, to load the page 4. Close the window (keyboard shortcut or click on the close widget) 5. Chrome> Quit Google Chrome 6. Launch Chrome What is the expected result? 1. Expect a new page with the Home Page setting to appear (New Tab or new page setting) What happens instead? 1. A page appears with www.google.com loaded (or whatever content or tabs were present in the last closed window)

title.$t: Command+Up and Command+Down Don't Work Properly

content.$t: Chrome Version : Google Chrome 3.0.182.5 (Developer Build ) URLs (if applicable) : OS version : 10.5.7 Behavior in Safari 3.x/4.x (if applicable): Works Properly Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): Works Properly Behavior in Chrome for Windows: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Browse to a long page. 2. Scroll to the middle. 3. Press Command+Up or Command+Down What is the expected result? The view should jump to the beginning or end of the page, respectively. What happens instead? The page scrolls the same amount as just pushing the up or down arrows. The Home (Function+Left) and End (Function+Right) keys work like Command+Up and Command+Down should.

title.$t: Gmail chats cannot be popped back in after opening a link

content.$t:
Platform:
