  RAM: 2048 MB

Chromium:
  Chromium version: 3.0.185 SNV Revision: 17893  Release
  QuickTime Player: 7.6
  Flash Player: 10.0.22.87

To reproduce:
  Start a chat with a friend in Gmail
  Have the friend send you a link in the chat
  Pop-out the chat into a new window
  Click the link in the chat
  Verify the link is opened in a new tab
  Click Pop-in

Expected behavior:
  The chat is moved back into the original Gmail window
  The Pop-out chat window is closed

Actual behavior:
  The chat is moved back into the original Gmail window
  The Pop-out chat window is not closed

title.$t: Cache dir needs to be under ~/Library/Caches

content.$t: Chrome Version : 3.0.189.0 URLs (if applicable) : OS version : 10.5.8 Behavior in Safari 3.x/4.x (if applicable): Stores cache files in ~/Library/Caches/com.apple.safari Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): not sure Behavior in Chrome for Windows: not sure What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Run Chromium What is the expected result? 2. Cache will be in ~/Library/Caches/com.google.chrome What happens instead? 2. Cache is in ~/Library/Application Support/Google/Chrome/Default/Cache Putting cache files under a predictable location for all applications makes it easy to exclude the cache from backups etc.

title.$t: New Tab Page shows blank thumbnails when lots of tabs opened fast

content.$t: Chrome: 3.0.189.0 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open www.google.com in first tab 2. Use Cmd-T to open 5 more tabs quickly What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected: All NTPs should show thumbnails. Actual: The NTPs show blank thumbnails FWIW, this only happens when a page is opened in the first tab, not otherwise

the content area to match. We should instead grow the window so the content
area doesn't change size.

content.$t: Chrome Version : 3.0.190.0 OS version : Mac OS 10.5.7 URL : maps.google.com Other browsers tested: Safari 4: OK Firefox 3.x: OK What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Browse to a location two notches above maximum zoom, and switch to satellite view. 2. Grab and pan around. What is the expected result? Smooth, flowing movement. What happens instead? Panning performance is choppy and noticeably worse than in Safari and Firefox. (Come on guys, Chrome should be OWNING this! :) Hardware tested: 20" 2009 iMac

title.$t: Chrome/mac doesn't support OS X's url handlers

Enter an url registered with OS X into chrome (e.g. "txmt://" if you have TextMate installed, "mvim://" if you have MacVim, or go to "apple.cm") What is the expected result? The registered url handler should be invoked (for "apple.cm", iTunes should be opened, for example). What happens instead? Nothing. (Do we have a default assignee for triage?)

title.$t: On gmail, focus unexpectedly jumps to the location bar every now and then and location bar is focussed on every tab switch

content.$t: Chrome Version : 3.0.195.1 URLs (if applicable) : OS version : 10.5.7 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Read your mail in gmail, use keyboard shortcuts (j, k, [, ]) to navigate What is the expected result? The keyboard shortcuts always be sent to gmail What happens instead? Sometimes, the focus jumps to the location bar, so that e.g. ']' is appended to the current url, instead of archiving the current mail and opening the next one in gmail. (Also, when then clicking the gmail UI to give it focus again, the omnibox stays open, so i have to click the location bar again, hit esc, an then click gmail and hit ']' again) Sorry, not consistently reproducible. But it happens multiple times per hour on the usual few-hundred-mails-per-day diet :-P

title.$t: Background images in the header don't line up with the background images in the body of the NTP

content.$t:
Because we don't have padding on the left, our images are horizontally off
by a few pixels. Do we want to shift the header pattern to compensate?

An example is the theme "Legal Pad" at the theme gallery:
https://tools.google.com/chrome/intl/en/themes/index.html .

title.$t: Experiment with hovers on Mac toolbar

content.$t:
Glen and I think the Mac toolbar feels to inert, and it's already non-standard 
enough. Cole should experiment with some hover animations for the buttons.

content.$t:
In the mac build, the menu that pops up for page/wrench appears next to the 
mouse, rather than being aligned to the button. This looks wrong.

title.$t: GMail triage seems slow in McChrome

content.$t:
I receive a lot of mail. I tend to scan the subject lines, select messages I don't 
need to actually read then archive it in batches.

Flow:
- click some checkboxes
- click archive
- repeat

This flow is noticably laggy in Chrome 198.0 (Developer Build 22501)... I 
press down on the archive button and it seems like 1/5-1/4rd of a second 
before it presses down.

title.$t: Call SSLSetPeerID to enable SSL session resumption on the Mac

content.$t:
We are not calling SSLSetPeerID on the Mac.  I haven't examined
our SSL packet traces, but I believe this means we're always
doing full handshakes and not resuming SSL sessions.

SSLSetPeerID is documented at
http://developer.apple.com/documentation/security/Reference/secureTransportRe
f/Reference/reference.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP30000155-CH1g-BCIFDEFB

title.$t: Chromium perf graphs don't display when opened in background tab

content.$t: I'm not sure if this is Mac-only and I've only got Macs here, so I'm leaving this at os:all for now. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open a Chromium perf graph in the background. Right-click this link and choose “open link in new tab,” or on the Mac, command-click this link: http://build.chromium.org/buildbot/perf/mac-release- 10.5/startup/report.html?history=5000 2. A new tab will spring to life in the background. Wait until its throbber stops spinning. 3. Switch to the new tab by clicking on it. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expect: perf graph should be visible. Observe: no perf graph visible. If you reload, the graph will become visible. Apparently, the graph sizes to the content area when the page loads. The new tab doesn't have any size. This might be similar to the old “new background tabs open at 200x200 or whatever” bug that we used to have. If you change the size of the window, the graph doesn't resize to match it. Maybe that's something we can fix about the graphs. 3.0.198.1 r23316 (official Google Chrome build)

Expected: Count number message go bold on Windows, so we should do the same. Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: OSX Omnibox text cursor does not match text editing area.

content.$t:
AutocompleteTextFieldCell adjusts the field-editor's editing area by a pixel or two, but doesn't 
adjust the cursor rect.  So if you move the mouse pixel by pixel, there are spots where the i-beam 
cursor appears which do not correspond to the text-editing area, and spots where the arrow cursor 
appears which do correspond to the text-editing area.

I believe the solution is to override -resetCursorRect:inView:.

title.$t: OSX Omnibox popup needs a drop shadow.

beng mentions that the Omnibox needs a drop shadow.  Suggests looking at the 
bookmark bubble's drop shadow, and/or talking to Cole, because it's not 
quite the regular window drop shadow.

title.$t: OSX Omnibox decorations need to downsize when the text gets big.

content.$t:
When the autocomplete field cannot fit the user-entered text and the full 
keyword search token, a shorter token should be used.  Likewise, if the 
search hints don't fit they should be omitted.  Verify this with other 
platforms.

title.$t: Chromium goes CPU bound on MacOS

content.$t: Chrome Version : 204.0 (Developer Build 24421) URLs (if applicable) : MacOS Version : 10.5.8 (Build 9L30) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Start up Chromium 2. It soon becomes CPU bound 3. Quit Chromium, the process still exists. 4. Have to force quit it What is the expected result? Not CPU Bound What happens instead? Chromium process is CPU Bound. New Tab window doesn't complete the previews. I don't know how this started, but here's the things I've attempted to correct it: 1. Restarted - it works for maybe a minute and then goes cpu bound again. Doesn't matter what URL's I go to. 2. Cleared cache 3. Upgraded to a newer nightly version. It originally started while running version 203.0 (Developer Build 23709) I haven't cleared all history and data yet since I want to be able to reproduce the issue to help get it resolved. Attached is the stack traces from the report which MacOS creates when I force quit it from Activity Monitor.

Observe: throbber (which, by the way, is embarrassing), and a favicon If we do want to keep the icon, maybe we should use something custom. Please use labels and text to provide additional information. 4.0.202.0 official release (r23673)

title.$t: Chrome Mac should use Mac editing behaviors instead of Windows editing behaviors

content.$t:
Some editing behaviors are controlled by a setting, such as:
1) Clicking below the last line of an editable area puts the caret at the end of the last line on Mac, but 
in the middle of the last line on Windows. 
2) Pushing the down arrow key on the last line puts the caret at the end of the last line on Mac, but does 
nothing on Windows. A similar case exists on the top line.

The setting is set based on PLATFORM(MAC), so Chrome, no matter what platform, falls back to Windows 
behaviors. See WebKit/WebCore/page/Settings.cpp where it sets 
EditingMacBehavior or EditingWindowsBehavior depending on PLATFORM(MAC). The right fix is probably to change 
PLATFORM(MAC) to OS(MAC), but that will need buy off from WebKit (maciej?).

This issue causes at least the following LayoutTests to fail:
LayoutTests/editing/selection/click-in-margins-inside-editable-div.html
LayoutTests/editing/selection/click-in-padding-with-multiple-line-boxes.html

Another bug showing a symptom of this: http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=20029

title.$t: Some menu item texts don't match the text the rest of OS X uses, other menu item text tweaks

content.$t:
Chrome Version       : 4.0.206.1
10.5.8

SysPrefs->Keyboard shortcuts has functionality to bind keyboard shortcuts 
to menu items, and the menu items are identified by text. For this reason 
(and for general consistency), Chrome/Mac's menu item texts should 
match the rest of the system.

Examples:

View->(Make Text Bigger, Make Text Default, Make Text Smaller) should 
be View->(Zoom In, Actual Size, Zoom Out)  (and the order should be 
"Actual Size, Zoom In, Zoom Out" to match the rest of the system, though 
that part is less important).

Window->(Next Tab, Previous Tab) should be Window->(Select Next Tab, 
Select Previous Tab)

View->Reload should arguably be View->Reload Page (matches Safari and 
Camino)

(Bookmarks->Bookmark Current Page is Bookmarks->Add Bookmark in 
Safari, but "Bookmark Current Page" is clearer and what Camino uses, and 
Firefox uses something else, so there's not much consensus on this item 
anyway -- so don't change it)

Other tweaks:

File->Open Locations… should be File->Open Location… (only one 
location being opened)

File->Open Recent should be removed, it's pretty much useless.

File->Reopen Closed Tabs… should be File->Reopen Closed TAb…, as in 
95% of all cases, this reopens a single tab. And two people I know have 
been confused by the plural.

title.$t: Arial should never be used on the Mac for UI

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Be able to tell the difference between Arial and Helvetica 2. Think that Arial is comparatively ugly (because it is) 3. Visit some web pages that use font-face:sans-serif 4. Suspect that the text looks like Arial, but be unsure because it's too small 5. Press command-+ (plus) a whole bunch of times to enlarge it What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expect: Helvetica, or for an even more Mac-like experience, Lucida Grande Observe: Arial Also observe: bad press for getting this wrong We're using Arial as the default sans-serif font and we shouldn't be. We're also hard-coding Arial in a number of places in our code, and we shouldn't be doing that either. Please use labels and text to provide additional information. 4.0.206.1 official release (206 branch r25349) 4.0.208.0 trunk r25632

title.$t: Close button on download and info bars doesn't have hover state and can get stuck in the mouse-down state

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Download something to get a download bar, or do something informational to get an info bar. 2. Hover over the close button Expect: hover state (even if you think our hover states are ugly, I think that these close boxes should match what we do with our tab close boxes.) Observe: no hover state. 3. Mouse down, then move the mouse off of the close button and mouse up, so that the button is not triggered. Expect: The hover-pressed state initially, and then hover-not-pressed state as the mouse leaves the close box. The hover-not-pressed state should remain until mouse up and then the button should return to its normal state, not hover or pressed. Observe: Looks like on mouse down, we go to the hover (not pressed) state, and then when the mouse moves off the button, we go to the pressed state. When the mouse goes up, the pressed state remains. Please use labels and text to provide additional information. 4.0.207.0 official release and trunk r26488

title.$t: kMDItemWhereFroms metadata attribute is missing from downloaded files

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.207.0 (Official Build 25617) URLs (if applicable) : OS version : 10.6.1 Behavior in Safari 3.x/4.x (if applicable): OK Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): FAIL Behavior in Chrome for Windows: N/A What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Download a file, e.g. gears-osx-opt.dmg. 2. Try to determine the file's origin without reference to chrome://downloads/ 3. What is the expected result? Once download is complete, the file should be placed in ~/Downloads and set the com.apple.metadata:kMDItemWhereFroms attribute to record its origin. $ mdls -name kMDItemWhereFroms gears-osx-opt.dmg kMDItemWhereFroms = ( "http://dl.google.com/gears/current/gears-osx-opt.dmg", "http://gears.google.com/download.html?statcb=1" ) What happens instead? The file is placed in ~/Downloads but the com.apple.metadata:kMDItemWhereFroms attribute is not set. As a result there is no mechanism (besides chrome://downloads/) to determine the file's origin. $ mdls -name kMDItemWhereFroms gears-osx-opt.dmg kMDItemWhereFroms = (null) The Finder exposes the contents of the kMDItemWhereFroms attribute in the Get Info window, and various third-party utilities, such as Hazel, use the information to facilite automated filing (for example to organise the Downloads folder by originating domain).

title.$t: Certificate view in Mac page info dialog sometimes shows incorrect status

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Navigate to an SSL site that uses a chained certificate (e.g., https://www.paypal.com 2. Bring up the View Page Info dialog 3. Click the View Certificate Information button What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Should see a dialog with "This certificate is valid"; instead it reads "This certificate was signed by an unknown authority" The problem appears to be the result of the certificate viewer not having access to intermediate certificate authorities that server sent in the SSL handshake. Since the certificate viewer can't trace the lineage back to a trusted anchor, it comes up with a different trust result than the networking layer, which has those intermediate certificates.

title.$t: Crash in [TabController inRapidClosureMode]

content.$t:
Copying a stack trace from Issue 22538, because I think this bug has a separate root cause.

#0  0x953bd688 in objc_msgSend ()
#1  0x05bfffba in -[TabController inRapidClosureMode] (self=0x21ccf40,
_cmd=0x724f650) at
/Users/vtl/dev/google/cr-git2/src/chrome/browser/cocoa/tab_controller.mm:243
#2  0x05c07aee in -[TabView mouseDown:] (self=0x189ca0, _cmd=0x953f2918,
theEvent=0x21cb210) at
/Users/vtl/dev/google/cr-git2/src/chrome/browser/cocoa/tab_view.mm:254
#3  0x94095af7 in -[NSWindow sendEvent:] ()
#4  0x940626a5 in -[NSApplication sendEvent:] ()
#5  0x93fbffe7 in -[NSApplication run] ()


Reproduce with:
1) Open a window with two tabs in it.
2) Drag one tab out into its own window
3) Grab that same tab and drag it around.  While dragging, right-click.

BOOM!

The second drag operation does something to delete the Browser object and create a new one.  
As part of this process, we destroy the TabStripController, but TabController still hangs on to a 
pointer.  Not sure why things aren't getting reparented correctly.

title.$t: Switching from rich text to plain text in gmail infinite-loops

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.221.8 URLs (if applicable) : http://gmail.com/ OS version : 10.5.8 Behavior in Safari 4.0.3 (5531.9): Switches from rich text to plain text. Behavior in Firefox 3.5.3: Switches from rich text to plain text. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to a gmail email 2. Click reply 3. Switch to and from rich text. 4. When the rich-text->plain-text button brings up a dialog, click yes. 5. Watch Chrome use one CPU completely and not switch to plain text. 6. Go to another google URL in that tab. 7. Watch it hang forever "Waiting for mail.google.com..." 8. Go to a non-google URL in that tab 9. Watch it get there successfully, and your CPU use go back down to normal. What is the expected result? Switches to plain text without using up a CPU. What happens instead? See steps.

Visual regression -> dmac

title.$t: Bubble (status bubble, pop-up blocker) background is blue instead of gray with default theme

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Use the default theme. 2. Hover over some links, or get some pop-ups blocked. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expect: the status bubble or pop-up blocker bubble should have a gray background. It does in 4.0.221.8 (221 branch r28160; the 221 branch was cut from trunk r28091). Observe: a blue background. This looks suspiciously like the same blue used for this purpose on Windows with the default theme. I am seeing this in trunk r28672. This is a new regression. I suspect that it occurred with the update from GTM r226 to r230, at our trunk r28613. The attached image shows a status bubble from 4.0.221.8 on top (gray, the original behavior) and r28672 on bottom (blue, regression). From -[BubbleView drawRect:] (chrome/browser/cocoa/bubble_view.mm:92): // workaround for default theme // TODO(alcor) next GTM update return nil for background color if not set; if ([color isEqual:[NSColor colorWithCalibratedWhite:0.5 alpha:1.0]]) color = nil; if (!color) color = [NSColor colorWithCalibratedWhite:0.9 alpha:1.0]; [color set]; [border fill]; When we reach this code at r28672, neither condition evaluates to true. In the past, I believe we were setting color to [NSColor colorWithCalibratedWhite:0.9 alpha:1.0]. I have no clue what Cole's comment actually means.

title.$t: cmd-` doesn't work when web contents has focus

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open two chrome windows, give focus to contents 2. Hit cmd-` What is the expected result? Windows should cycle What happens instead? Nothing. This is a regression caused by me sending keyboard events to the renderer first. When they come back, I only send them to the main menu, and we don't have a "Cycle windows" menu entry bound to cmd-`. Finder does e.g. have this. I think the best fix is to just add this menu entry? Are there other keyboard shortcuts that should Just Work but are not in a menu item?

title.$t: Last added auto search engine disappears from search engine list when tried to make default.

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Try to browse any search engine which adds to search engines list automatically Example: hulu.com ( Make sure it is not added before ) 2. Go to Preferences --> Manage --> Search Engines window 3. Try to make default of newly added one. ( It will show as last entry to select in the list ) Actual: The search engine entry disappears from the list. What is the expected output? Windows and Linux behavior? Entry should stay or show in the list even after making default. Note: Reopening of same window helps to see the entry back on the list. What happens if it is a User added search engine? Currently on this build its a blocker to verify ( Cant add custom search engine ) . Verified with previous builds, the last user added search engine ( last entry in the list ) when marked as default it jumps one entry top of other search engines in list. Default search engine drop down in preferences goes blank. We had a bug for this.

title.$t: Command-W beeps at me instead of closing my tabs

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Have some tabs 2. Want to have fewer tabs 3. Command-W What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I expect a tab to close when I press command-W. Instead, I get beeped at. Sometimes, when I press command-T and then quickly press command-W while the new tab is springing, I get beeped at. If I open a whole bunch of tabs and then hold down command-W, I'll get beeped at for sure. This may be because of the gymnastics that we go through to switch command-W between close-tab and close-window, but I see this when I have a boatload of tabs open, so nothing should be changing the command-W binding. This may also be because of something new we're doing with offering these commands to the renderer. I don't think that this used to suck as badly as it does now, so maybe there's something to the renderer theory. Please use labels and text to provide additional information. Trunk r29077

title.$t: Write design doc for fullscreen behavior

content.$t:
Our fullscreen behavior is sometimes weird, sometimes inconsistent.  We should write up a design 
doc detailing exactly what functionality we want to support.  Things to consider:

- Can we open new tabs? close tabs? switch tabs?
- We grey out a number of menu commands, but their keyboard shortcuts sometimes still work.
- What if we get a javascript alert that originates in a background (non-fullscreen) window?
- How should http auth sheets work?  Can we switch between fullscreen/nonfullscreen while they 
are open?

Look to windows for inspiration.

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Launch chrome. 2. Perform Chrome-> Open File (Command+O) 3. Quit Chrome.
